intro: Hieracium inflexum, commonly known as the bentleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium inflexum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
